string-array.item: Blessed are the meek, for they shall possess the earth.\n(Matthew 5,4)
Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be consoled.\n(Matthew 5,5)
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for justice, for they shall be satisfied.\n(Matthew 5,6)
Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.\n(Matthew 5,7)
Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.\n(Matthew 5,8)
Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.\n(Matthew 5,9)
Blessed are those who endure persecution for the sake of justice, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.\n(Matthew 5,10)
You are the light of the world. A city set on a mountain cannot be hidden.\n(Matthew 5,14)
So then, let your light shine in the sight of men, so that they may see your good works, and may glorify your Father, who is in heaven.\n(Matthew 5,16)
But I say to you: Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you. And pray for those who persecute and slander you.\n(Matthew 5,44)
But when you give alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing, so that your almsgiving may be in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will repay you.\n(Matthew 6,3–4)
But you, when you pray, enter into your room, and having shut the door, pray to your Father in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will repay you.\n(Matthew 6,6)
For if you will forgive men their sins, your heavenly Father also will forgive you your offenses.\n(Matthew 6,14)
Instead, store up for yourselves treasures in heaven: where neither rust nor moth consumes, and where thieves do not break in and steal.\n(Matthew 6,20)
The lamp of your body is your eye. If your eye is wholesome, your entire body will be filled with light.\n(Matthew 6,22)
Therefore, seek first the kingdom of God and his justice, and all these things shall be added to you as well.\n(Matthew 6,33)

A merciful man benefits his own soul. But whoever is cruel casts out even his close relatives.\n(Proverbs 11,17)
Open your works to the Lord, and your intentions will be set in order.\n(Proverbs 16,3)
Better is a little with justice, than many fruits with iniquity.\n(Proverbs 16,8)
It is better to be called to vegetables with charity, than to a fatted calf with hatred.\n(Proverbs 15,17)
Possess wisdom, for it is better than gold. And acquire prudence, for it is more precious than silver.\n(Proverbs 16,16)
Arrogance precedes destruction. And the spirit is exalted before a fall.\n(Proverbs 16,18)
Whoever is wise in heart shall be called prudent. And whoever is sweet in eloquence shall attain to what is greater.\n(Proverbs 16,21)
The heart of man disposes his way. But it is for Lord to direct his steps.\n(Proverbs 16,9)
Careful words are a honeycomb: sweet to the soul and healthful to the bones.\n(Proverbs 16,24)
Whoever is a friend loves at all times. And a brother is proved by distress.\n(Proverbs 17,17)
A joyful soul makes a lifetime flourish. A gloomy spirit dries out the bones.\n(Proverbs 17,22)
A correction benefits more with a wise man, than a hundred stripes with a fool.\n(Proverbs 17,10)
A correction benefits more with a wise man, than a hundred stripes with a fool.\n(Proverbs 17,10)
The heart of a man is exalted before it is crushed and humbled before it is glorified.\n(Proverbs 18,12)
The doctrine of a man is known through patience. And his glory is to pass beyond iniquities.\n(Proverbs 19,11)
Do not say, \"I will repay evil.\" Wait for the Lord, and he will free you.\n(Proverbs 20,22)
Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue guards his soul from anguish.\n(Proverbs 21,23)
Let not your heart compete with sinners. But be in the fear of the Lord all day long. For you will have hope in the end, and your expectation will not be taken away.\n(Proverbs 23,17–18)
Behold, God is my savior, I will act faithfully, and I will not be afraid. For the Lord is my strength and my praise, and he has become my salvation.\n(Isaiah 12,2)
And the work of justice will be peace. And the service of justice will be quiet and secure, forever.\n(Isaiah 32,17)
But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will take up wings like eagles. They will run and not struggle. They will walk and not tire.\n(Isaiah 40,31)
Do not be afraid, for I am with you. Do not turn away, for I am your God. I have strengthened you, and I have assisted you, and the right hand of my just one has upheld you.\n(Isaiah 41,12)
For I am the Lord your God. I take you by your hand, and I say to you: Do not be afraid. I have helped you.\n(Isaiah 41,15)
The Lord has called me from the womb; from the womb of my mother, he has been mindful of my name.\n(Isaiah 49,1)
Behold, I have engraved you on my hands. Your walls are always before my eyes.\n(Isaiah 49,16)
For my thoughts are not your thoughts, and your ways are not my ways, says the Lord.\n(Isaiah 55,8)
Rise up to be illuminated, O Jerusalem! For your light has arrived, and the glory of the Lord has risen over you.\n(Isaiah 60,1)
From ages past, they have not heard it, and they have not perceived it with the ears. Apart from you, O God, the eye has not seen what you have prepared for those who await you.\n(Isaiah 64,4)
And this shall be: before they call out, I will perceive; while they are still speaking, I will hear.\n(Isaiah 65,24)
\"Before I formed you in the womb, I knew you. And before you went forth from the womb, I sanctified you.\"\n(Jeremiah 1,5)

\"Am I not able to do with you, O house of Israel, just as this potter has done?\", says the Lord. \"Behold, like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, O house of Israel.\"\n(Jeremiah 18,6)
And you shall call upon me, and you shall go forth. And you shall pray to me, and I will heed you.\n(Jeremiah 29,12)
You shall seek me. And you will find me, when you have sought me with your whole heart.\n(Jeremiah 29,13)

And I will build you up again. And you shall be built up, O virgin of Israel. Still shall you be adorned with your timbrels, and still shall you go forth to the singing of those who play.\n(Jeremiah 31,4)
Then the virgin will rejoice with singing, the young and the old together, and I will turn their mourning into gladness, and I will console them and gladden them after their sorrow.\n(Jeremiah 31,13)

Thus says the Lord: \"Let your voice cease from crying and your eyes from tears. For there is a reward for your work, says the Lord. And they will return from the land of the enemy.\"\n(Jeremiah 31,16)
The Lord appeared to me from a distance: \"And I have loved you in perpetual charity. Therefore, showing pity, I have drawn you.\"\n(Jeremiah 33,3)
He is the liberator and the savior, performing signs and wonders in heaven and on earth, who has freed Daniel from the lions\' den.\n(Daniel 6,28)
